channel.title: BM Forum Meetup
channel.description: I was just wondering if any fellow 'Strayan forumers would be interested in having some kind of informal gathering to celebrate the release of BM and get on the piss and burn the shit out of some steaks. Since we're all spread out across the country, it could possibly happen in several locations i.e. Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide depending on how many people would be interested. This would be in a similar fashion to those Reddit meetups that happen every so often. Just gauging interest at the moment, but would anyone actually want to do this?

item.title: BM Forum Meetup
item.dc:creator: CygNuS
item.description:
striker:

You know, you belgian folks strike me as a type, who love making fun of their country. How come?

And don’t tell me: “it’s Belgium!”

Love your 300 sorts of beer, your chocolate and sometimes your language

Good to hear!

I don’t really know why we make fun of our own country. The way our country is portrayed in the world makes us look at it and think: hmm, it must indeed look ridiculous that some want to divide such a small country in 2, or that the political situation is so complex, or that there are 3 official languages etc…
We know we’d laugh too if it weren’t our country, so why be hypocrites

This explains a little maybe: https://www.justlanded.com/english/Belgium/Belgium-Guide/Culture/Belgian-cultural-cliches
They say it’s a unique, self-deprecating sense of humor, I couldn’t say it better.

We (most of us) very much like other people/nationalities who aren’t that uptight or arrogant and who don’t take themselves too seriously. That’s also why there are almost never succesful Belgians (artists, sportsmen) abroad with diva-attitudes.

On the other hand, we are very proud of our country too and are glad to share it: our school-knowledge of English, French, German and Dutch, also the beer, fries, waffles, chocolate, music artists doing very well abroad (Selah Sue etc.), festivals like Tomorrowland,…

Read full topic

item.title: BM Forum Meetup
item.dc:creator: GarynDakari
item.description:
DanielSangeo:

I’m not too good at holding up my end of the conversation to be honest. I find myself being quiet and letting the other person talk…and I can only seem to respond with mm-hmms or yeahs and not really contributing much. In larger groups, I can stay fairly quiet and, if there’s something I want to add, I can wait for a lull in the conversations to add it, but if the conversation drifts away before I have a chance to say it, oh well. I like listening. I don’t like talking.

Online, it’s fine because I can formulate a response before posting and I’m not expected to have something snappy. If I do try to speak, I stumble over my words unless I am very knowledgeable about a subject or very passionate about it…but otherwise, Porky Pig would tell me to do something about it.

Ha, exactly the same thing here - My most-uttered word in RL is a sound like “Hm…” Not even a word, just a sound Though, in recent months, I have become slightly less awkward. I’ve been making a conscious effort to use words and sentences rather than murmurs.

Anyway, meetup sounds fun, but I doubt there are many/any Oregonians here. Oregon just doesn’t seem to be a nerd-filled place, sadly.

Read full topic

item.title: BM Forum Meetup
item.dc:creator: CygNuS
item.description:
Dr. Strangelove:

But on the downside it’s Belgium.

Also true

CPU:

Beer…check
French Fries…check
Mayonaise…does not compute. Please explain

It tastes good, try it. Mayonaise or ketchup is kinda the first choice of sauce for fries here.

(rot)(fodder:

I could eat Miracle Whip out of the jar.

Though with french fries? I will have to test this before I comment. (I suspect traditional mayonnaise would be better for that.)

EDIT: But Gravy and cheese now, seriously Belgium. All the cool countries eat their fries with Gravy and Cheese.

I don’t know Miracle Whip but traditional egg-made-mayonaise is very good with fries.
Gravy and cheese? Hm, never said we were cool, lol.

Read full topic
